replies.bodyText:
I should have added a comment here -- will fix it.
I've found out that DefaultRequestContextInstrumentation and implementation-specific RequestContextInstrumentations (e.g. Resteasy31RequestContextInstrumentation) worked differently when executed in different order.

In case of default -> impl order: the default instrumentation has always created a span, but without adding the ABORT_HANDLED marker, so the impl instrumentation also ran; span != null so only the span names were updated.
In case of impl -> default: span was also not null (because the servlet span would be the current span), so no new span was started here; ABORT_HANDLED marker was added though. The default instrumentation did not run; in this case we were missing one span.
